title: Riot removed Veigars instant stun cage, gutting him. What is annie?
body:
Riot removed Veigars instant stun cage and put a delay on it, effectively gutting him.
My question is, why the hell is Annie allowed to exist in her current state then? Not only does she have an instant stun on tibbers, she also has 2 more targeted stuns on Q/W!

"But Tibbers and W are skillshots!"

No, no they are not! It's impossible to miss tibbers since the cast time is instant, and in addition to it stunning you, it also bursts you and has a burn aura. And even if tibbers ISN'T up, you can just press W and get off a good AOE anyway.

I will preface this by saying that I think Veigar was difficult and problematic; that Veigar needed changes.

I also think that he needs more changes. Despite his more stable, higher win rate, he hasn't been fixed yet. He needs more changes, more buffs and maybe some compensatory nerfs to remove the surplus. If Riot does anything else they will probably over buff him.

Onto the post:
Annie's existence doesn't actually matter anyway. Consider this analogy.

A person is suffering from two diseases. Neither of these diseases is fatal, but both are debilitating. One disease is easier to cure. 
Should we not cure the person of one disease because he has a second, harder to cure disease?

League of Legends has two burst mages with effectively targeted stuns that can be immediately followed by burst. Both play patterns are unhealthy.
Veigar was easier to deal with - add a delay to his stun, then compensate. Annie is harder - she has several effectively targeted stuns and can't be compensated with larger AP gains. To fix her will take time. Should we keep Veigar in a problematic state just because Annie exists?
